Please check the main.debug in the debug folder after running the code to get a concise picture of the whole run.

Function Documentation

int main ( int  argc,
char **  argv 
)

Main Program - Takes care of the complete flow from calling the lexer to parse the verilog description, setting up the circuit structures to setting up the fault sets for the test and actually performing the test and capturing the test vectors. Please check the main.debug in the debug folder after running the code to get a concise picture of the whole run.

Parameters:
The main function takes in the name of the verilog file which has the circuit description.
Returns:
Always returns a value of 0.

MAIN FUNCTION TASKS

Call the lexer to parse the verilog description and populate the circuit data structure.

Open all the files needed for writing debug info.

Levels are needed for evaluation.

Name the branch wires correctly.

Write both possible faults for each wire in the fault file.

Create a test object to run ATPG

Read the faults from a pre-specified file into the test object's data structure.

Finally run ATPG on the fault set.
